div.l: And hadde a wyf that held for contenaunce
A shop ⁊and swyued for hyr sustenaunce
Here endyth the Cokys Tale / And begynneth
the man of lawys prologe
OVre host saw wel that by þᵉ bryght sonne
The ark of hys artificial day had ronne
The fourthe part ⁊and half an houre ⁊and more
And theygh he were not deppest stert in lore
He wyste wel it was the xviij day
Of apryl that is messanger to may
And sawe wel that the shadow of euery tre
Was as in lengthe of the same quantite
That was the body erect that causid it
And therfore by the shadow he took hys wyt
That phebus whyche that shon so clere and bryght
Degrees was xlv clomben on heyght
And for that day as in latytude
Hyt was ten of the clocke he gan conclude
And sodenly he plyght hys hors aboute
Lordyngis quod he I warne you all the Route
The fourth part of thys day is goon
Now for the loue of god and saynt Iohn
Lese no tyme as ferforth as ye may
Lordyngis the tyme wastyth bothe nyght and day
And stelyth fro vs what pryuely slepynge
And what thurgh neglygence in our wakynge
As doth the streme that turneth neuer agayn
Descendyng fro the mounteyn in to the playn
Wel can senek and many a philosophir
Bewaylen tyme more than gold in cofyr
For losse of catell may recouered be
But losse of tyme shendyth vs quod he
It wyl not come ayen wythouten drede
Nomore than wol Malkynes maydenhede
Whan that she hath lost it in hyr wantownesse
Let vs not mowlyn thus in Idelnesse
